channel.title: Weird item.cfg error? please read still need fix after all these posts
channel.description: On my new computer, my item.cfg is kinda weird. On my old computer it worked 100% but the moment i transferred it to my new pc, it became weird. first, it after the the item id of 17000 something, the font changes. When i try saving, it reminds me that it is going to save as a text-only format. I use wordpad to edit it. I used wordpad on my old pc. Is there something wrong with my pc? Also, i used a smalled, 0.9mb item.cfg and it worked. My item.cfg is 1.9mb. Does it have anythng to do with the size?

item.title: Weird item.cfg error? please read still need fix after all these posts
item.dc:creator: @thock321 thock321
item.description:
@thock321 wrote:

I didnt add spaces. Remember, it was working 100% on my old computer. I downloaded another dspk servers item.cfg, same problem. This is not a space error. I even replaced all spaces with nothing and still same error (those spaces that were in there by default, not manually added). BTW that error wasnt from my compiler, it was from my run.bat

Read full topic
item.source: Weird item.cfg error? please read still need fix after all these posts

item.title: Weird item.cfg error? please read still need fix after all these posts
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:10, topic:431101”][quote author=lemme_winks_ link=topic=533775.msg3902685#msg3902685 date=1327904197]

Stop trying to sound fancy and get to the point. You used spaces instead of tabs. Find whatever you edited and use tabs instead of spaces.

using spaces could have caused the compiler to throw the error
[/quote]

But it most likely wouldn’t because I’ve came across this situation before.[/quote]
the ambiguous problem vs compiler output

Read full topic

item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“lemme_winks_, post:9, topic:431101”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=533775.msg3902681#msg3902681 date=1327904086]
Stop trying to sound fancy and get to the point. You used spaces instead of tabs. Find whatever you edited and use tabs instead of spaces.
[/quote]

using spaces could have caused the compiler to throw the error[/quote]

But it most likely wouldn’t because I’ve came across this situation before.

item.source: Weird item.cfg error? please read still need fix after all these posts

item.title: Weird item.cfg error? please read still need fix after all these posts
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Stop trying to sound fancy and get to the point. You used spaces instead of tabs. Find whatever you edited and use tabs instead of spaces.

using spaces could have caused the compiler to throw the error

8 spaces = 8 bytes
1 tab = 1 byte

Read full topic

item.title: Weird item.cfg error? please read still need fix after all these posts
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“thock321, post:4, topic:431101”]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 17 at server.world.ItemHandler.loadItemList(ItemHandler.java:377) at server.world.ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:34) at server.Server.<clinit>(Server.java:65) Press any key to continue . . .
i don’t get this error on my old computer. I use notepad. I haven’t edited item.cfg since transferring it[/quote]

you’re most likely accessing an index in an array that doesn’t exist

Read full topic
